persistence.application: Persistence control is delegated to the application.
persistence.filesystem: State of in-flight messages is held in persistent storage and prevents loss of messages to some degree in case of a client failure.
persistence.memory: State of in-flight messages is lost in case of a client shutdown or failure. Some messages may not be delivered even with QoS 1 or higher.

qos.atLeastOnce: Messages are guaranteed to be delivered at least once by acknowledging receipt of a message.
qos.atMostOnce: Fastest method, but the delivery of a message is not guaranteed.
qos.exactlyOnce: Safest but slowest method. Message is guaranteed to be delivered exactly once utilizing a 4-part handshake.

tlsModes.intermediate: General-purpose servers with a variety of clients, recommended for almost all systems. Supports Firefox 27, Android 4.4.2, Chrome 31, Edge, IE 11 on Windows 7, Java 8u31, OpenSSL 1.0.1, Opera 20, and Safari 9.
tlsModes.modern: Services with clients that support TLS 1.3 and don't need backward compatibility. Supports Firefox 63, Android 10.0, Chrome 70, Edge 75, Java 11, OpenSSL 1.1.1, Opera 57, and Safari 12.1.
tlsModes.old: Compatible with a number of very old clients, and should be used only as a last resort. Supports Firefox 1, Android 2.3, Chrome 1, Edge 12, IE8 on Windows XP, Java 6, OpenSSL 0.9.8, Opera 5, and Safari 1.

messages.readFailed: Failed to read contents of MID list file.

addr.duplicate: This device address is already on the MID list.

mid.duplicate: Device MID is already on the MID list.
mid.len: Device MID should be 8 characters long.
mid.regex: Device MID should only contain hexadecimal characters.

notes.addressSpace: If enabled, only specified adresses will be assigned to found nodes. If MID list is used, addresses specified in MID list but not in address space will not assigned.
notes.addressSpaceFormat: The valid format is an enumeration of device addresses (1 - 239) separated by comma or as an interval: {range}.
notes.hwpidFilter: If enabled, only devices with specified HWPIDs will be added to the network.
notes.hwpidFilterFormat: The format is an enumeration of HWPIDs (0-65535) separated by comma. E.g. 4117,4099.
notes.midControl: If enabled, it is possible to bond nodes by their MIDs. Optionally, network address can be specified for each MID.
notes.midFilter: If enabled, detected MIDs that are not listed will not be added to the network. This feature prevents bonding of unknown devices.
notes.midRule1: 1. If MID is listed with address and the address is free, this address will be assigned.
notes.midRule2: 2. If MID is listed without an address, the first free and not reserved address will be assigned.
notes.midRule3: 3. If MID is not listed and MID filtering is disabled, the first free and not reserved address will be assigned.

addressSpace.regex: The address space format is invalid or address space contains addresses outside of allowed range.

emptyWaves.between: Number of empty wavess should be between 1 and 127.
emptyWaves.integer: Number of empty waves should be an integer.

waves.between: Maximum number of waves should be between 1 and 127.

note.duplicatedAddresses: Unbonds nodes with MIDs that mismatch MIDs in coordinator memory. This may occur in some situations during Autonetwork.
note.inconsistentMidsInCoordinator: Sets MIDs in coordinator to MIDs of the bonded nodes. This may occur during upgrade of OS or DPA.
note.uselessPrebondedNodes: Unbonds ramaining nodes with the universal address used in prebonding, from the network. This may occur during Autonetwork when creating overlapping network.
